intro: Psittacanthus pinicola, commonly known as the pineleaf sterculia, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that resemble pine needles, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Psittacanthus pinicola is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
